node.title: 'Have patience': Hot, lengthy traffic delays in upper North Island as holidaymakers clog up highways
node.description: Motorists are asked to add extra time to their journeys.
node.content: ["There are several traffic delays around the upper North Island as holidaymakers travel to and from their destinations on Monday afternoon.", "In Waikato, police say there is a lot of traffic congestion on State Highway 2 through the Karangahake Gorge, and vehicles are particularly slow-moving on the stretch of road from Paeroa to Waihi.", "\"A music festival in Waihi, combined with holiday traffic, is likely to be contributing to the delays,\" they say.", "\"Motorists are asked to have patience if they absolutely must travel, and consider delaying your trip if possible.\"", "The music festival in Waihi is Gold Rush, which was set to feature UK drum and bass acts Dimension and Wilkinson. Both are self-isolating after Dimension tested positive for the Omicron variant of COVID-19 and failed to follow government regulations, not self-isolating for the required period.\n", "NZTA says there are also delays on SH1 for those travelling from Hamilton towards Tirau and drivers are asked to add extra time to their journey.", "In the Bay of Plenty on SH29 there are delays eastbound between Lower Kaimai and Tauriko. NZTA also recommends adding extra time to your journey if you're travelling on this stretch of road.", "There's also holiday traffic on the Coromandel peninsula with delays on SH25 in both directions coming into Tairua.", "In Auckland, earlier on Monday, there were delays on SH1 southbound between Manukau and P\u014dkeno, but NZTA says this has now cleared.\n"]
